name: Grizzly Grammar
description:
HAVE YOU EVER SEEN A HUNGRY GRIZZY BEAR? I MEAN…REALLY HUNGRY? WELL, DON'T LOOK NOW BUT THERE'S ONE RIGHT BEHIND YOU! IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE HIS DINNER, YOU'VE GOT TO GET THE POT OF HONEY AND GIVE IT TO HIM. BUT FIRST, YOU'VE GOT TO MATCH ALL OF THE RIGHT HOMOPHONES TO THEIR SENTENCES. HURRY!!!

Grizzly Grammar is a single-player game that explores the concept of homophones (words that sound the same but have different meanings and are spelled differently) and is aimed at children ages 7-9. The goal of the game is to match the correct words to the sentence until you reach 100 points. Once you earn 100 points, you will have enough money to purchase some honey and tame the bear. Tip: match the homophones when you see them, you cannot go back to retrieve any you did not capture!

CONTROLS: ARROW KEYS TO MOVE, Z TO JUMP

To complete sentences, drag the appropriate word to the ___________ in the sentence. Each sentence is worth 10 points. To earn additional points, kill the evil mushrooms by jumping on them. Your score will be located in the top left-hand corner of your screen.
